H0.text: where did the yoruba originated from. Ancient Egyptians

H1.text: where did the yoruba originated from. Mesopotamians

H2.text: where did the yoruba originated from. Indo-Europeans

H3.text: where did the yoruba originated from. African people

A4.text: The Yoruba are a West African ethnic group who inhabit parts of Nigeria, Benin, and Togo

A5.text: Yoruba people have a sense of group identity based on shared cultural concepts, beliefs and practices. Prominent among these is the tracing of the Yoruba body through dynastic migrations to roots in Ile-Ife, an ancient city in the forested heart of central Yorubaland
